abstracts.cdata!:
A Records and Archives Center will be
            built to provide a safe repository for government records as
            one of the components of the Uganda Public Service
            Performance Enhancement Program (UPSPEP). This environmental
            impact assessment addresses negative environmental impacts
            associated with this component. Negative impacts include
            conversion of a residential site for public use; improper
            management of excavated or filled soil leading to dust
            plumes that affect air quality; loose soil in storm water
            clogging adjacent drains; traffic congestion; generation of
            demolition waste; stripped vegetation and land overburdened
            from site leveling operations; loss of trees; improper waste
            disposal; incineration of office waste leading to air
            pollution if it is not operated according to
            manufacturer's specifications or improperly maintained;
            dust; and noise from electricity generators. Impact
            abatement measures that are recommended include on-site
            waste management practices like document incineration;
            having workers protect against occupational safety risks
            such as exposure to noise, dust, and body injuries by using
            safety latches, for example; having professional engineers
            and architects supervise construction; replanting with low
            maintenance native species and marking uncut trees for
            protection; suppressing dust with water spraying and issuing
            dust masks to workers; restricting construction activities
            during the daytime; providing silencers for equipment to
            control noise; transporting lubricants and fuels in
            appropriate containers such as sealed drums; transporting
            materials during off-peak hours; limiting stockpiling to
            areas away from drains; placing low beams around piles and
            covering open piles; properly storing hazardous chemicals;
            preparing a site waste management plan; and disposing of
            un-reusable construction waste at an approved landfill.
